I recommend this for Portal Veterans and Newcomers alike. Though, if you don't get the plot, I recommend getting Portal 1 first. :) This game includes A-LOT of humor, and mind-bending puzzles. Also great if you want to play a co-op mode with a friend to make it more frustratingly challenging. :)

This game is awesome... enough said.

Think you're smart? Think you're a detective? Looking for a good story that doesn't revolve around exploding baddies? This might just be the game for you! It's a story first, and game second, not that the game play is bad, it's top tier, but the main attraction is the story...so many secrets...so many questions left unanswered....
Now this will tickle your stemcells!
Melhor jogo puzzle de todos os tempos! Não é dificil mas se não usar a cabeça não passa de fase. O unico problema é que depois que você zera não tem mais nada pra fazer.
As good as the first one but with more indepth areas to explore and a silly/intense plot line. :3 Yay puzzles

You monster.
Awesome game... 10/10!

One of the most amazing single player experiences I've had.

This is a puzzle game with FPS controls, but it is one of the strongest storytelling/immersion games I have ever played. Valve has really perfected its style of using the environment to unobtrusively tell a story without getting in the way of gameplay or resorting to cutscenes.

This game is not just a rehash of portal, its a sequel that completely outshines the original (which was very good by the way). I found portal 1 a bit tiresome at times, but portal 2 does such a good job with environments, characters, voices and backstory. 

I Definitely recommend playing through Portal 1 first before playing this (Portal 1 will blow your mind also if you play it first, and 2 just takes it to a whole new level).

Excellent presentation. Definitely play it.
Gorgeous graphics and atmosphere, highly inventive gameplay, and humor to boot. You'll never enjoy being quarantined underground in real life as much as you will in Portal.

Really good, its the only game in ~7 years that I played from the begging to the end (except the previous 2 portal games). Though still too easy. Only one level on which I thought WTF! & had no idea what to do for like 30mins.

Der 2. Teil des mehrfach ausgezeichneten Vorgängers. Singleplayer wird durch längere Spielzeit und viele neue Möglichkeiten noch vieeeel besser UND (jetzt kommt der Knüller) KOOP-MODUS mit speziellen Leveln (bzw. Testkammern) und somit ultimativem TEAMplay.

Beides gewürzt mit jeder Menge Witz und Humor. Ist sein Geld auf jeden Fall wert (wi schon der 1. Teil) und ich kann es ebenfalls nur wärmstens empfehlen.

Klassiker!!!

When life gives you lemons you make lemonade
and when life gives money you buy Portal 2. Simple as that.

Portal 2 occupies its own space among the most celebrated games of the early 2010's, and for good reason.

Portal 2 is the direct successor to Portal, a 2007 game of the same style and format. Neither game has any kind of learning curve and either one can be picked up by any gamer at a moment's notice.

Portal 2 features a sarcastically humorous story facilitated by a series of increasingly challenging puzzles intermixed with guided exploration. The sceneric and musical artwork of the game is immersive and engaging while the soundtrack is highly adapted to the various moods evoked by the plot. The music alone is worth half the price of the game, is available separately, and is a fine addition to any library.

Despite the games magnificence, it has minimal replay value. Though highly immersive, the story is concise and the puzzles are predefined. Aside from perfecting one's performance in a singular set of puzzles and hunting for easter eggs, one can expect a non-varied experience between playthroughs.

Because of the length and overall quality of the game, Portal 2 is well worth its price. Playing Portal, this game's predecessor, is recommended but not at all necessary for a complete experience.

Due to the sarcastic and cynical nature of the game's humor, this game is not ideally suited for the youngest of audiences. Despite this, both Portal games manage the delicate feat of being tremendously friendly to players who have never held a controller before while remaining challenging to those who have been gaming their entire lives.
horrible

I ain't gonna lie, I utterly enjoyed Portal 2, from start to finish. Ending was very very good. From the moment you start the game, it's an amazing sense to know this progresses the difficulty with new additions to classic game mechanics. Portal 2 was hilarious and the ending was very much worth the effort to play the game.

My favourite game, it has everything and it does everything right. The characters are great, the levels, puzzles and mechanics are great, co-op mode is great. I can literally find no fault with this game, it improved perfectly from the first game, its just genius.

Hard to improve on perfection but somehow Valve did it.
Read my other recommendation for the first one and then multiply that by like a thousand.
Addition of co-op was brilliantly executed and  the in game extras are fun.

Its getting to a point where I just buy Valve games on principle now.  You always get a polished,  bug-free,  beautiful piece of artwork that has finely tuned controls and amazing gameplay.
If you haven't played this.... I can't be your friend.

A great sequel that focuses on physical puzzles and timing as a significant part of the gameplay. Unlike the first game, this one includes 2 player co-op multiplayer, which (depending on your partner) is quite fun the first few times through. Expands on the plot of the first game, and takes it in some weird-but-interesting directions.
Loved the Co-Op. Co-Op was a little bit short though. There should be more to do in Co-Op. Plenty to do in Single-Player though. This game is definitely harder than the first however. Worth buying.
Great co-op and single player puzzle game. Story line is very funny at times.
Best game ever 2.

a fantastic game. my only complaint is that it isn't  longer because I loved every bit of it. A wonderfully crafted game with a lot of details. Somehow they gave a puzzle game suspence and story. Playing back through with commentary is worth it. The co-op is fun and challenging.

Not sure why, but was really hoping they'd take this off the rails a bit more. Still awesome, but could have been way more awesomerer. The multiplayer is great fun, but really missing the feature to have selective amnesia about your progress so your buddy doesn't miss the little detail experiences that add to the atmosphere. 5/5

At first I was unsure whether one of the best games could be made to feel fresh again, especially with elements such as 'non robotic' voices that I felt were key to the first Portal. However, without a doubt VALVe have made one of the best games even better! The sense of humor in this game is fantastic, and had me crippled with laughter at many points in the game. Stephen Merchant also plays a top-class part as Wheatley, who I started off unsure about but then became one of my favourite Portal characters. This game is amazing, very much like the rest of VALVe's games.
A great game guaranteed to please any puzzle fanatic.

This game used to be about 7 times as long as the first portal when it was released, but now thanks to the steam community, it is practically infinite. If you are a fan of portal 1, this is a game which you unquestionably need to have. If you have to choose between portal 1 and 2, though, 2 is definitely a far better deal when considering the prices. If you are still debating on whether or not to get anything from the portal series, let it be known that it IS a very challenging puzzle game, but it is to this day the greatest puzzle game I have ever played, and probably one of the greatest games of all time.

I was ready to be disappointed by this as a sequel, but I couldn't help but admire the care they put into it to sidestep the obvious "repeating joke" potholes. Let's just hope the saga ends here, with a satisfying coda.

PURE LEGEND!  This game is just incredible.  It's a blast to play, but can stress your brain a bit.  Tough some times coming home from a full day of work and tryihng to take on this one.  The graphics are quite good and it supports 3D surround wihtout any tweeks.  The co op is even better, if you can find someone who's good enough to play with.  You should try Portal 1 before you play this.

这么说吧，如果出了第三代，我会在第一时间立马购买的。
Amazing

Ich habe mir Portal 2 damals vorbestellt und hatte sehr viel Spaß damit. Die Story ist unglaublich fesselnd und um einiges komplexer als die von Portal 1. Zwar motiviert die Story an sich nicht unbedingt zu einem erneuten Playthrough, allerdings lohnt sich ein wiederholtes Durchspielen und das Erkunden der Testkammern ungemein alleine wegen den vielen Easter Eggs. Sobald der Singleplayer bewältigt ist wartet allerdings noch eine äußerst umfangreiche kooperative Kampagne, diese ist vor allem zu empfehlen, wenn man einen Freund hat, der beim lösen der Rätsel mit einem skyped, da im Coop-Modus Kommunikation einen wichtigen Bestandteil darstellt. Einige Zeit nach Release kamen dann von Fans erstellte Testkammern (noch weit vor der Einführungs des Workshops), welche Valve mit einem ins Spiel gepatchten Tool unterstützte und die Erstellung solcher Custom Maps vereinfachte. Alles in allem lohnt sich ein Kauf zum Vollpreis für Fans von Portal 1 und anderen Puzzlespielen, da Portal 2 mittlerweile einen nahezu unerschöpflichen Content zu bieten hat.

Infinitamente divertido y con muchisimo humor. Esta vez hay bastante mas argumento, que aunque no es complicado entretiene desde el principio hasta el final. Tanto GladOS como el nuevo compañero no pararán de hacer comentarios durante el juego para que no te aburras entre test y test. El cooperativo es una opción que se debe jugar, aunque una vez acabado no parece tener interes en volver a hacerlo.

macht sehr viel spaß, leider nur 5 sunden :D
dann ist man normal durch ^^

Portal 2 is an absolutely astonishing game. It takes the word Aperture to a whole new level. You really explore a much wider story line, the plot is absolutely amazing, along with the graphics, the gameplay, wonderful game.

Now your thinking with portals!

What I consider a perfect sequel. Takes everything that was great about the original and only goes up from there. The humor is funnier, the puzzles are tougher, the game is longer, and the story is is deeper. The game is filled with twists, and the difficulty keeps ramping up leaving you with satisfaction after every puzzle. The environments are much more diverse. The pristine test chambers are now overrun with floral plants. Beneath the chamber lurks retro chambers with a great 50's feel. In between the walls are deep mechanical catacombs with many secrets. The world feels more alive, and is brought to life with many characters. Glados is more hateful, Wheatly is adorably stupid, and Cave Johnson... is just pure awesome. A new Co-op mode presents some of the most challenging chambers and a new twist on gameplay. Plus the PS3 version comes with Steam which is awesome.

epic funny and chalanging
this game has it all
overal i would give it 1000000000000000000000000000000000000000/10

I would recommend this game to just about anyone... Also almost any age. 

To truly understand the stoy line I also recommend you play the first Portal, you wont regret playing that game either, and it is a great warm up for Portal 2!

La suite de Portal, solo un peu plus long avec un scénario prenant, toujours plein d'humour, le seul défaut que je lui reproche : on sent que le jeu est orienté coop, finalement les joueurs solo restent un peu sur leur faim. Je recommande quand même le jeu, à faire au moins une fois, ne serait-ce que pour le solo et les nouveautés qu'on y trouve.

There is nothing to be said about this game. It's all been said. Every criticism, every praise, every moment has been dissected, disseminated, upheld, and lambasted. There's no point in discussing media which was overmined, overhyped, overdismissed, and underwhelming months before its release. The game was doomed from the get go as a conversational piece. They tried to make it less quotable, less driven by one-liners, less meme-able, less reduced to a single out-of-context t-shirt exclamation but it was futile. You cannot stop viral marketing. You cannot stop fanbases. You cannot stop, period. We've entered an era where it's better to toil in obscurity, better for yourself to never know the joy of people enjoying your work, never to know the horror of people taking your work and wearing it like a signifier of some vague, consumption-driven cultural identity. Every fan, every kind word, every compliment portends the downfall of your creative drive.

The puzzles were too easy 7/10
